import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.b265fa94:

pubg = pubg[:1000000]
source.1a084502: %matplotlib inline # so that I don't have to type plt.show() everytime
source.674fd6fb:
#converting them
pubg['matchType'].replace(['squad-fpp','duo-fpp','solo-fpp','normal-squad-fpp','crashfpp','normal-duo-fpp','flaretpp',
                           'normal-solo-fpp','flarefpp','normal-squad','crashtpp','normal-solo','normal-duo'],
                          ['squad','duo','solo','squad','others','duo','others','solo','others','squad',
                          'others','solo','duo'],inplace=True)
#others matchtype represent names of types which I can't personally distinguish as solo/squad/duo even after searching on kaggle
source.cae26881:
sns.factorplot('assists','winPlacePerc',hue='matchType',data=pubg)
f = plt.gcf()
f.set_size_inches(15,8)
plt.title('Assists vs winPlacePerc')

source.8245a040:
f,ax=plt.subplots(1,2,figsize=(18,6))
sns.distplot(pubg.damageDealt,kde=True,ax=ax[0])
plt.title('Density Graph of DamageDealt')
sns.scatterplot('damageDealt','winPlacePerc',hue='matchType',ax=ax[1],data=pubg)
plt.title('DamageDealt vs winPlacePerc')
source.64a30f97:
for i in range(5):    
    plt.title('DamageDealt with winPlacePerc = '+str(0.4+(i/10))+' - '+str(0.4+(i+1)/10))
    pubg[(pubg['winPlacePerc']>=0.4+(i/10))&(pubg['winPlacePerc']<0.4+((i+1)/10))].damageDealt.plot.hist(color='red',edgecolor='black',bins=20)
    plt.show()

plt.title('Headshot Kills vs winPlacePerc')

source.7efd45ea:
f,ax = plt.subplots(2,2,figsize=(15,10))
sns.barplot('kills','winPlacePerc',data=pubg[pubg['matchType']=='solo'],ax=ax[0,0],palette='Blues')
ax[0,0].set_title('Solos')
sns.barplot('kills','winPlacePerc',data=pubg[pubg['matchType']=='duo'],ax=ax[0,1],palette='Blues_r')
ax[0,1].set_title('Duos')
sns.barplot('kills','winPlacePerc',data=pubg[pubg['matchType']=='squad'],ax=ax[1,0],palette='OrRd')
ax[1,0].set_title('Squads')
sns.barplot('kills','winPlacePerc',data=pubg[pubg['matchType']=='others'],ax=ax[1,1],palette= 'OrRd_r')
ax[1,1].set_title('Others')

source.ab094596: print('The highest ride distance by a player :',pubg['rideDistance'].max())
source.a76a5161:
for i in range(5):    
    plt.title('RideDistance with winPlacePerc = '+str(0.4+(i/10))+' - '+str(0.4+(i+1)/10))
    pubg[(pubg['winPlacePerc']>=0.4+(i/10))&(pubg['winPlacePerc']<0.4+((i+1)/10))&(pubg['rideDistance']<10000)].rideDistance.plot.hist(color='red',edgecolor='black',bins=20)
    plt.show()

source.b29c404d:

f = plt.gcf()
f.set_size_inches(10,8)
plt.title('TeamKills vs winPlacePerc (duos and squads only)')

source.f70107e2:
# Most of the data have walkdistance value < 10000m. So that's why I have put a limit on it in below code
pubg[(pubg['winPlacePerc']>0.9)&(pubg['walkDistance']<10000)].walkDistance.plot.hist(bins=50,edgecolor='black')
f = plt.gcf()
f.set_size_inches(12,9)
plt.title('WalkDistance Frequency')

source.d6f49e59: %%html
source.29428a4e: Boosts : Number of boost items used. (Energy Drinks, PainKillers, Adrenaline Syringe)
source.2aacd63e: Revives : Number of times this player revived teammates.
source.eea1d7bf: How can someone travel 33KM in a single match ??? Can be a potential outlier !
source.25c0c44d: Someone killed 65 players in a single match !!!!!!!!! You gotta be kidding me ! Let's see who he is :
source.5bbd8bd7: So people who had killed others with distance more than 200m have good chances of survival/winning !
source.6a896c49: NOTE : This is going to be meaningless for solos !
source.085cebf5: Longest Kill : The longest distance in meters a person has killed someone.
source.22a727db: In all the matches, having higher kills generally corresponds to higher chances of winning ! There are some inconsistencies after 15 kills or higher in solos, duos, squads but that might be becuase players who want to fight don't really play to win, they just want to kill !
source.a31429c7: The first thing I am going to do is to combine heals and boosts since survival in a game is mostly governed by these two !
source.853859ab: Nevertheless, Having assists till 5-6 values is a good indication of having a good winPlacePercentage.
source.790cba51: Walkdistance : Distance walked by player in metres
source.6b31fd22: The above graph looks like a normal distribution. This checks with the fact that the circle forms randomly and by Central Limit Theoremm, half of the people actually have to walk towards the circle whereas other half are going to be inside ! This can be verified by the average distance walked. Let's see :
source.523830be: It is quite understandable to say the more kills you have the more chances you have to win/survive.
source.d09a3912: Assists : Number of enemy players this player damaged that were killed by teammates
source.35e489aa: Heals : Number of healing items used.(First aids, Bandages,MediKits)
source.5efd9dd3: This should give us a better idea of how much probability a player has at winning than other similar attributes like kills since headshots are generally difficult to take and are taken by more skilled players
source.ad55dc1d: Damage dealt is a continuous feature. So plotting has to be in a similar fashion
source.53a420d9: KillStreaks : Max number of enemy players killed in a short amount of time
source.c13f1ab4:
The above is a tableau created dashboard. It is an interactive dashboard which you can interact with using hover or selecting a particular bubble. Do that to understand better !

The bigger the bubble is, the more the data it holds.

What is particularly interesting about this workbook is, when you analyse this workbook, the amount of kills/weapons aqcuired etc. are going to be generally more for winPlacePerc = 1.0 and less for winPlacePerc = 0, giving an indication of positive correlation within the variables except for killPlace in which as we saw above, a negative correlation can be observed !
source.f2e3ba80: So by data, the fights usually start at around 23 minutes of match start and majority of them die in this period as well(the first peak of the graph). This can be fourth or fixth last circle ! Then at 30 minutes, due to the last/second last circle, people have no other alternative apart from a one on one (see the second peak of the graph)
source.cdfaa014: MatchDuration : Duration of match in seconds
source.bae8f9db: The data above shows people who didn't really deal a lot of damage but still ended up getting a good place ! This well might be because of people hiding themselves for majority of the game (proners and campers) !
source.ed64b152: Now personally speaking I don't really think assists should have been given importance in solos since you can't really knock someone is solos. I don't understand what it represents, maybe killing someone who has already been shot by someone else and has low health.
source.3069115f: KillPlace : Ranking in match of number of enemy players killed. (Rank 1 means most players killed in that match)
source.12af1e06: There are higher chances of ones winning if a person has used heals more than 0 times and understandably so ! Also solos have players using more healing items than duos or squads.
source.e7519434: ### Kill Points is a feature which is calculated by rankpoints feature. RankPoints is inconsistent and will be deprecated so I won't be using both of these features !
source.989342e8: Let's see how the combined correlation compares to that of individual heals and boosts :
source.c0e97223: HeadshotKills is very informative. As can be seen from the plot above, the more the headshots people have, the better the chances of winning.
source.9eb2bb6e: Weapon Acquired : Number of weapons picked up
source.be695a2a: There seems to be a positive correlation between weapons acquired and winPlacePerc. Let's see !
source.fab0a482: RoadKills : Number of kills when in vehicle
source.655ef60e: Kills : Number of enemy players killed.
source.42895110: Well it is easily understandable and can be verified by the above cross tab that squads are generally going to have moe revives than any other matchtype. Let's take a closer look at it !
source.60106e46: Having high range kills would mean a better player and kinda understandably so!
source.1a45a8b2: Damage Dealt : Total damage dealt. Note: Self inflicted damage is subtracted
source.b0a7d69d: As I talked about in the above section, a player who is known to take more headshots will generally be a more skilled and a worthy winner indeed. Now headshot kills represent the number of enemies killed by headshots. This generally can be misleading since if I killed only one player that too by headshot, this might have happened out of sheer chance ! Also if I killed 5 people out of which only 1 was by headshot, I may not be skilled enough. So I am going to create a feature HeadshotSkill which would accurately depict my skill level based on data and is formed below :
source.c085c4e7: The more the revives a player performs, the better his chances becomes at winning. But after 6 revives per player, the winning percentage decreases or a specific pattern can't be observed. This may be because you are being knocked out more often than not would make you a NOOB !
source.702223e9: So what I did in the above line is basically, all those players who have dealt more than 500 damage to enemies in solo match but still managed to have a winPlacePerc of 0.0. Is this badluck or a case of outliers ?
source.279412a5: There isn't much that can be said about killstreaks since we can't really see a pattern ! I mean, I would expect someone with a killstream of 5 or above to have better chances of winning ! But the data doesn't follow the same intuition ! A lot of data who had 8 as killstreak only has < 0.3 as winPlacePerc
source.710de8a6:
1. Boosts have a higher correlation with winPlacePerc even more than heals.
2. KillPlace and winPlacePerc have high negative correlation which is something we saw above !
3. DamageDealt,Heals,Kills,KillStreaks,LongestKill,RideDistance,WeaponsAcquired all of these have considerable correlation with winPlacePerc as well.
4. WalkDistance seems to have the highest correlation with winPlacePerc which can prove to be useful in a prediction model !
source.3d1f0429: VehiclesDestroyed : The number of vehicles destroyed by a single player !
source.0219649d: Majority of the people use less than 6 boosts per game !
source.00ee4836: There seems to be a negative correlation between the two features and understandably so since if I am at rank 1 in kills in a match, I probably have achieved a good rank overall !
source.f8b2e63a: Team Kills : Number of times player killed team mates
source.a69e2db3: DAMN DAWGGGG !!!!! You got a bright future in your scope !
source.70dd29d0: Before starting with EDA or anything else, I am going to change the matchTypes to the three main ones which a pubg lover personally knows and loves !
source.1dad016d: ### Let's see if we have any missing data !
source.494d5ef5: Correlation of health with winPlacePerc is comaparitively lower than just with boosts. But this helps us with two things. Our model won't overfit with keeping just boosts as the prime feature winPlacePerc is based on and also heals and boosts combined together will make for a more robust prediction ! You can see afterwards if just keeping boosts instead of our new feature health has more impact on our predictions or not !
source.cf51a2b6: But that decreases after 8-9 assists. This could potentially represent players who are good only at assists than  killing and winning ! Remember this is going to matter more in squads since assists might help your team to go forward in the game but if you are only good at assisting and not killing chances of victory are substantially reduced !
source.f3a4225b: The negative correlation can be seen from the above heatmap. I mean obviously the more kills I have, the lesser killPlace rank I will have, and hence better will be my chances of winning !
source.47dbbbc9: Players who do have some team kills are comparitively less in numbers who have higher winPlacePerc ! This is something I am glad to see, because of the traitors and my brothers also who have betrayed me in an otherwise great match !
source.a71e931f: Having higher roadkills means better chances of winning ! I didn't expect something like this. I personally have killed a lot of people and destroyed a lot of vehicles when in a vehicle, makes me a pro player I guess !
source.eb4838ac: Cheaters ! Hackers ! Might even have one data row of my hacker brother !
source.da5f9474: There is still a positive correlation between the two !
source.e7289497: HeadShotKills : Number of enemy players killed with headshots.
source.2d4e13f3: Can be misleading sometimes since I can kill someone 1000m away who is knocked out ! But let's see
source.da53d8b5: Well now the above one is just sheer badluck !
source.3c729c08: A correlation though not substantial can be seen !
source.5c4221bb: Damn ! Someone who has destroyed even a single vehicle or more proves to be having a higher chance of survival and winPlacePercentage. Terminator !
source.901050f1: From the graph and cross tab above, it is evident that players using more than 5-6 boosts per game are less in number but have higher chances of winning ! This is quite understandable in itself.
source.38fdf3b1: There isn't much difference between the means of damage dealt between the major three classes of matchTypes. But there is one thing which can be noted from the scatter plot above. See below :
source.0c7c756e: Ride distance increases for the players with hgh winPlacePerc. The increase is not substantial but can be seen !
source.0d357120: I personally despise team kills a lot and obviously if a match is based on team vs team, having lesser membes is a disadvantage !
